memberdef.name: PyIsoTpMethods
memberdef.initializer:
= { {"init", pyisotp_init, METH_VARARGS, "Initialize ISO-TP link"}, {"send", pyisotp_send, METH_VARARGS, "Send data over ISO-TP"}, {"poll", pyisotp_poll, METH_VARARGS, "Poll ISO-TP link for timeouts and state updates"}, {"receive", pyisotp_receive, METH_VARARGS, "Receive data from ISO-TP link"}, {"mock_enable_drop", py_mock_enable_drop, METH_VARARGS, "Enable or disable CAN frame dropping in the mock CAN driver"}, {"mock_disable_fc", py_mock_disable_fc, METH_VARARGS, "Enable or disable FlowControl frames in the mock CAN driver"}, {"time_advance", py_time_advance, METH_VARARGS, "Advance virtual time in the mock time implementation"}, {"time_set", py_time_set, METH_VARARGS, "Set virtual time in the mock time implementation to a specific value"}, {"time_reset", py_time_reset, METH_VARARGS, "Reset virtual time in the mock time implementation to zero"}, {"get_last_protocol_result", py_get_last_protocol_result, METH_VARARGS, "Get last sender protocol result"}, {"get_last_receive_protocol_result", py_get_last_receive_protocol_result, METH_VARARGS, "Get last receiver protocol result"}, {"set_timeouts", py_set_timeouts, METH_VARARGS, "Set N_Bs and N_Cr timeouts in milliseconds"}, {"set_fc_params", py_set_fc_params, METH_VARARGS, "Set FlowControl block size and STmin in milliseconds"}, {"inject_can", py_inject_can, METH_VARARGS, "Inject raw CAN frame into the ISO-TP link"}, {NULL, NULL, 0, NULL}
}

memberdef.name: pyisotp_module
memberdef.initializer: = { PyModuleDef_HEAD_INIT, "pyisotp", "Python bindings for ISO-TP-C library", -1, PyIsoTpMethods }

briefdescription.para: Initializes an ISO-TP link and returns a capsule containing the link pointer to Python.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to the module object (unused in this context)

- Tuple of arguments passed from Python, expected to contain:
sendid (uint32_t): CAN ID to send on

simplesect.para: PyObject* - Python object representing the result of the operation, typically a capsule containing the IsoTpLink pointer or an error indicator

briefdescription.para: Sends data over an ISO-TP link.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to the module object (unused in this context)

- Tuple of arguments passed from Python, expected to contain:
py_link (PyObject*): Capsule containing the IsoTpLink pointer
data (bytes): Data to send

simplesect.para: PyObject* - Python object representing the result of the operation, typically an integer status code

briefdescription.para: Polls an ISO-TP link for timeouts and state updates.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to the module object (unused in this context)

- Tuple of arguments passed from Python, expected to contain:
py_link (PyObject*): Capsule containing the IsoTpLink pointer

simplesect.para: PyObject* - Python object representing the result of the operation, typically None

briefdescription.para: Receives data from an ISO-TP link.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to the module object (unused in this context)

- Tuple of arguments passed from Python, expected to contain:
py_link (PyObject*): Capsule containing the IsoTpLink pointer
bufsize (Py_ssize_t): Size of the buffer to receive data into

simplesect.para: PyObject* - Python object representing the result of the operation, typically bytes containing received data or None if no data

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables CAN frame dropping in the mock CAN driver.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to the module object (unused in this context)

- Tuple of arguments passed from Python, expected to contain:
enable (int): Flag to enable or disable CAN frame dropping

simplesect.para: PyObject* - Python object representing the result of the operation, typically None

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables FlowControl frames in the mock CAN driver.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to the module object (unused in this context)

- Tuple of arguments passed from Python, expected to contain:
enable (int): Flag to enable or disable FlowControl frames

simplesect.para: PyObject* - Python object representing the result of the operation, typically None

briefdescription.para: Returns the last protocol result for the sender side.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to the module object (unused in this context)
- Tuple of arguments passed from Python (expected to be empty for this function)

simplesect.para: PyObject* - Python object representing the result of the operation, typically an integer status code

briefdescription.para: Returns the last protocol result for the receiver side.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to the module object (unused in this context)
- Tuple of arguments passed from Python (expected to be empty for this function)

simplesect.para: PyObject* - Python object representing the result of the operation, typically an integer status code

briefdescription.para: Sets the timeouts for the ISO-TP link.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to the module object (unused in this context)

- Tuple of arguments passed from Python, expected to contain:
py_link (PyObject*): Capsule containing the IsoTpLink pointer

detaileddescription.para:
n_cr_ms (uint32_t): N_Cr timeout in milliseconds
PyObject* - Python object representing the result of the operation, typically None

briefdescription.para: Sets the FlowControl parameters for the ISO-TP link.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to the module object (unused in this context)

- Tuple of arguments passed from Python, expected to contain:
py_link (PyObject*): Capsule containing the IsoTpLink pointer

listitem.para: block_size (uint32_t): Block size for FlowControl (0 means unlimited)

detaileddescription.para:
st_min_ms (uint32_t): STmin in milliseconds
PyObject* - Python object representing the result of the operation, typically None

briefdescription.para: Injects a raw CAN frame into the ISO-TP link for testing purposes.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to the module object (unused in this context)

- Tuple of arguments passed from Python, expected to contain:
py_link (PyObject*): Capsule containing the IsoTpLink pointer
data (bytes): Raw CAN frame data to inject (must be 2..8 bytes)

simplesect.para: PyObject* - Python object representing the result of the operation, typically None

briefdescription.para: Advances the virtual time in the mock time implementation by a specified delta.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to the module object (unused in this context)

- Tuple of arguments passed from Python, expected to contain:
delta (uint32_t): The number of milliseconds to advance the virtual time

simplesect.para: PyObject* - Python object representing the result of the operation, typically None

briefdescription.para: Sets the virtual time in the mock time implementation to a specific value.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to the module object (unused in this context)

- Tuple of arguments passed from Python, expected to contain:
value (uint32_t): The value to set the virtual time to, in milliseconds

simplesect.para: PyObject* - Python object representing the result of the operation, typically None

briefdescription.para: Resets the virtual time in the mock time implementation to zero.

parameterdescription.para: - Pointer to the module object (unused in this context)
- Tuple of arguments passed from Python (expected to be empty for this function)

simplesect.para: PyObject* - Python object representing the result of the operation, typically None

briefdescription.para: Releases an ISO-TP link capsule and its allocated buffers.
